snippet: Before comic books, the cheaply printed pulp magazines fed young readers’ appetites for tough guys, femmes fatales and outlandish villains.
abstract: Syracuse University's Palitz Gallery features exhibit Orange Pulp: the Pulp Magazine & Contemporary Culture, which will explore the mass-produced magazines from the first half of the 20th century that were known for their bold covers, melodramatic narratives, low price and cheap paper.
lead_paragraph: Before comic books, the cheaply printed pulp magazines fed young readers’ appetites for tough guys, femmes fatales and outlandish villains.

headline.seo: University Museum Recalls Pulp Fiction’s Lurid Covers and Purple Prose
headline.main: Exhibition Recalls Slam-Bang World of Pulp Magazines
headline.print_headline: Exhibition Recalls Slam-Bang World Of Pulp Magazines
